column4: I just changed sshd to run on a nonstandard port, and did /etc/init.d/ssh restart
but now i get connection closed by (ip address) when I try to ssh in - any ideas?
you need to specify the port
this isn't the first machine I've done this to, but it's the first ubuntu machine i've done it to
is sshd listening on that port ?
yep.  i can even telnet in to that port and i get an OpenSSH 'prompt'
ah.   something is already listening on that port, ipv6...?
I switched it to a different port and it works fine - How can I figure out what the heck 'tcp6' is listening to on ::8022 ?
one of the times I ran /etc/init.d/ssh restart, I did it as a normal user
so a normal-user had that port open!
